alert.note: Alert for Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Rockcastle; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:14AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Wayne, Laurel, Pulaski, north central McCreary and southern Rockcastle Counties through 600 AM EDT... At 514 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Dudley Station to 7 miles northeast of Jamestown. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mount Vernon, Donaro, Withers, Jep Hill, Sinks, Gauley, Dudley Station, Pine Hill, Flat Rock and Orlando around 520 AM EDT. Horse Lick, Camp Wildcat and Hazel Patch around 525 AM EDT. Templer, Mershons, Lamero, Hare and Nancy around 530 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Monticello, Mill Springs, Victory, Steubenville, East Bernstadt, Carmichael, Frazer, Betsey, Atlanta, Burnside, Kidder, Delta, Quinton, Gregory, General Burnside S.P., Tateville, Bronston, Maplesville, Langnau, Deer Lick, Denney, Sloans Valley, Alpine and Ritner. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 8. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 34 and 60. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 1 and 11. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 17 and 40. Louis B. Nunn Parkway MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
